page.title: 08CRANAGE SCHOOL
page.content: Our school was built in 1705 by Thomas Hall, who aiso built Cranage Hall. Part of it is not a school at all, but is a rented house. There are only two classroom, a library area, and dining room ,kitcten and toilets. The toilets used to be outside in the playground , but two years ago an extension was built onto the school to put in toilets for the pupils and the staff. Because of the size of the school there are only a few children here.In the infants there are 15 children and 22 in the juniors. There is also our headmaster,one Full-time teacher, one part-time teacher and three kitchen ladies. Our cookhas worked here for 21 years and now has a very modern kitchen to work in. not all of the school children have school dinner but some bring packed lunches.
